title: John Bercow has thrown another spanner in the already mangled Brexit works
text:
With eight days remaining of his time in the Speaker’s chair, John Bercow again threw a spanner into the already-mangled Brexit works when he rejected the Government’s request to stage another meaningful vote in Parliament. He has been a central figure in this unfolding drama ever since Theresa May tried and failed three times to get her deal through the Commons. If Mr Bercow has felt uncomfortable with the notoriety that goes with such a starring role he has shown no sign of it.

He objected to the characterisation of his Speakership as partisan against Brexit, insisting he had been even-handed between the two factions in seeking to uphold the rights of Parliament. Many MPs on the Brexit side...
